delegates elected on a functional rather than a geographical basis

functionalism.definition:
1) a psychology based on the assumption that all mental process are useful to an organism in adapting to the environment
2) any doctrine that stresses utility or purpose

functionality.definition: capable of serving a purpose well

examples.en: the two units are functionally interdependent

functioning.definition: performing or able to perform its regular function

fund.definition:
1) convert (short-term floating debt) into long-term debt that bears fixed interest and is represented by bonds
2) place or store up in a fund for accumulation
3) provide a fund for the redemption of principal or payment of interest

fundamental.definition:
1) any factor that could be considered important to the understanding of a particular business
2) being or involving basic facts or principles
3) far-reaching and thoroughgoing in effect especially on the nature of something

examples.en: fundamentals include a company's growth, revenues, earnings, management, and capital structure
the fundamental laws of the universe
the fundamental revolution in human values that has occurred

fundamentalism.definition: the interpretation of every word in the sacred texts as literal truth

fundamentalist.definition: of or relating to or tending toward fundamentalism

fundamentals.definition: principles from which other truths can be derived

examples.en: first you must learn the fundamentals

funds.definition: assets in the form of money

fundus.definition: (anatomy) the base of a hollow organ or that part of the organ farthest from its opening

funeral.definition: a ceremony at which a dead person is buried or cremated

examples.en: hundreds of people attended his funeral

funerary.definition: of or for or relating to a funeral

funereal.definition: suited to or suggestive of a grave or burial

fungi.definition: the taxonomic kingdom including yeast, molds, smuts, mushrooms, and toadstools; distinct from the green plants

fungia.definition: a genus comprising the usual mushroom corals

fungible.definition: of goods or commodities; freely exchangeable for or replaceable by another of like nature or kind in the satisfaction of an obligation

fungus.definition: an organism of the kingdom Fungi lacking chlorophyll and feeding on organic matter; ranging from unicellular or multicellular organisms to spore-bearing syncytia

funicle.definition: the stalk of a plant ovule or seed

funicular.definition: relating to or operated by a cable

funiculitis.definition: inflammation of a funiculus (especially an inflammation of the spermatic cord)

funiculus.definition: any of several body structure resembling a cord

funk.definition:
1) a state of nervous depression
2) United States biochemist (born in Poland) who showed that several diseases were caused by dietary deficiencies and who coined the term `vitamin' for the chemicals involved (1884-1967)
3) an earthy type of jazz combining it with blues and soul; has a heavy bass line that accentuates the first beat in the bar

funky.definition:
2) (of jazz) having the soulful feeling of early blues
3) stylish and modern in an unconventional way
4) in a state of cowardly fright

examples.en: we did it all in black and white in a very funky sixties style

funnel.definition:
1) move or pour through a funnel
2) a conically shaped utensil having a narrow tube at the small end; used to channel the flow of substances into a container with a small mouth
3) (nautical) smokestack consisting of a shaft for ventilation or the passage of smoke (especially the smokestack of a ship)

examples.en: funnel the liquid into the small bottle

funnel-shaped.definition: shaped in the form of a funnel

examples.en: told the doctor about the funny sensations in her chest

fur.definition:
1) the dressed hairy coat of a mammal
2) dense coat of fine silky hairs on mammals (e.g., cat or seal or weasel)
3) a garment made of the dressed hairy coat of a mammal

furan.definition: a colorless toxic flammable liquid used in the synthesis of nylon

fur-bearing.definition: of animals having fur (especially of commercial quality)

furcation.definition: the place where something divides into branches

furcula.definition: a forked bone formed by the fusion of the clavicles of most birds

furfural.definition: a liquid aldehyde with a penetrating odor; made from plant hulls and corncobs; used in making furan and as a solvent

fury.definition:
1) a feeling of intense anger
4) (classical mythology) the hideous snake-haired monsters (usually three in number) who pursued unpunished criminals

examples.en: hell hath no fury like a woman scorned
his face turned red with rage

furiously.definition:
1) (of the elements) in a wild and stormy manner
2) in a manner marked by extreme or violent energy
3) in an impassioned or very angry manner

examples.en: she went peddling furiously up the narrow street
she screamed furiously at her tormentors
furled sails bound securely to the spar

furlong.definition: a unit of length equal to 220 yards

furlough.definition:
1) dismiss, usually for economic reasons
2) grant a leave to

examples.en: She was laid off together with hundreds of other workers when the company downsized
The prisoner was furloughed for the weekend to visit her children

furnace.definition: an enclosed chamber in which heat is produced to heat buildings, destroy refuse, smelt or refine ores, etc.

furnarius.definition: type genus of the family Furnariidae: ovenbirds

examples.en: We furnished the house in the Biedermeyer style

furnished.definition: provided with whatever is necessary for a purpose (as furniture or equipment or authority)

furnishing.definition:
1) (usually plural) accessory wearing apparel
2) (usually plural) the instrumentalities (furniture and appliances and other movable accessories including curtains and rugs) that make a home (or other area) livable
3) the act of decorating a house or room

furniture.definition: furnishings that make a room or other area ready for occupancy

examples.en: they had too much furniture for the small apartment
there was only one piece of furniture in the room

furnivall.definition: English philologist who first proposed the Oxford English Dictionary (1825-1910)

furosemide.definition: commonly used diuretic (trade name Lasix) used to treat hypertension and edema

furred.definition: covered with a dense coat of fine silky hairs

furring.definition: a furlike coating of matter as on the tongue

furrow.definition:
1) hollow out in the form of a furrow or groove
2) make wrinkled or creased
3) cut a furrow into a columns

furrowed.definition: having long narrow shallow depressions (as grooves or wrinkles) in the surface

examples.en: his furrowed face lit by a warming smile

further.definition:
1) to or at a greater extent or degree or a more advanced stage (`further' is used more often than `farther' in this abstract sense)
2) in addition or furthermore; further, they should be here already"

examples.en: further complicated by uncertainty about the future
stated further that he would not cooperate with them

furthermore.definition: in addition; furthermore, their quality is improving"; moreover, mice nested there"

examples.en: computer chess games are getting cheaper all the time

furthest.definition: to the greatest degree or extent or most advanced stage (`furthest' is used more often than `farthest' in this abstract sense)

examples.en: went the furthest of all the children in her education

furtive.definition: marked by quiet and caution and secrecy; taking pains to avoid being observed

examples.en: the soldiers were furtively crawling through the night

furtiveness.definition: a disposition to be sly and stealthy and to do things surreptitiously

furunculosis.definition: acute skin disease characterized by the presence of many furuncles

fuscous.definition: of something having a dusky brownish grey color

fuse.definition:
1) an electrical device that can interrupt the flow of electrical current when it is overloaded
2) become plastic or fluid or liquefied from heat
3) equip with a fuse; provide with a fuse

examples.en: The substances fused at a very high temperature

fusee.definition:
2) a colored flare used as a warning signal by trucks and trains
3) a friction match with a large head that will stay alight in the wind

fuselage.definition: the central body of an airplane that is designed to accommodate the crew and passengers (or cargo)

fusible.definition: capable of being melted and fused

fusilier.definition: (formerly) a British infantryman armed with a light flintlock musket

fusion.definition:
1) an occurrence that involves the production of a union
3) the merging of adjacent sounds or syllables or words
4) a nuclear reaction in which nuclei combine to form more massive nuclei with the simultaneous release of energy

fuss.definition:
1) worry unnecessarily or excessively
2) an angry disturbance

examples.en: don't fuss too much over the grandchildren--they are quite big now
he didn't want to make a fuss

fusty.definition:
1) stale and unclean smelling
2) old-fashioned and out of date

fustian.definition: a strong cotton and linen fabric with a slight nap

futilely.definition: in a futile and unproductive manner

futility.definition: uselessness as a consequence of having no practical result

futon.definition: mattress consisting of a pad of cotton batting that is used for sleeping on the floor or on a raised frame

future.definition:
1) yet to be or coming
2) effective in or looking toward the future
3) (of elected officers) elected but not yet serving

examples.en: some future historian will evaluate him
he was preparing for future employment opportunities

futureless.definition: having no prospect or hope of a future

futurism.definition:
1) an artistic movement in Italy around 1910 that tried to express the energy and values of the machine age
2) the position that the meaning of life should be sought in the future

futurist.definition: a theologian who believes that the Scripture prophecies of the Apocalypse (the Book of Revelation) will be fulfilled in the future

futurity.definition: the quality of being in or of the future

futurology.definition: the study or prediction of future developments on the basis of existing conditions

fuzz.definition: the first beard of an adolescent boy

examples.en: his head fuzzed like a dandelion gone to seed

fuzzy.definition: confused and not coherent; not clearly thought out

examples.en: a vague and fuzzy idea of the world of finance
